alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 04 at 12:30PM PST until January 05 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible within the entire Watch area. Areas of most concern include the Alisal burn scar, urban roads and freeways, and in creeks and streams. * WHERE...All of San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara Counties, including the Alisal burn scar. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST this afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Significant flash flooding is possible anywhere. This includes mud and debris flows in and below the Alisal burn scar. Urban areas should expect significant flooding of some roads and freeways, with major delays or closures. Excessive runoff will result in flooding of creeks and streams. While the risk of main stem river flooding is low, water flowing through normally dry rivers and washes will threaten homeless encampments. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong atmospheric river storm will bring periods of widespread heavy rainfall with rates up to around an inch per hour. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches will be common over urban areas, with 4 to 8 inches expected in the mountains and foothills, especially over the Santa Lucia and Santa Ynez ranges. Isolated amounts of 10 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding, including the Alisal burn scar, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop or evacuations are ordered.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains
